result.execSummary:
The defendant Valentino B Mendoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Not to request early termination of probation.
------------------------------------

miscConds.notes:
Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
-------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
----------------------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
-------------------------------------

Possess no weapons. Defendant will not possess any ammunition. Firearms will be forfeited and destroyed
--------------------------------

timeConds.notes:
in Walworth County Jail.

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court. 

With Huber. Defendant is eligible for Huber. IT IS HEREBY Ordered that the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward all restitution and outstanding fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence. 
------------------------------

records.addlTxt: Defendant Valentino B Mendoza in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Valentino B Mendoza.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant plead guilty to count # 1. Upon motion of the state counts #2 and #3 were dismissed and read-in. Motion granted. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation. Court sentences defendant. Minutes filed.

Defendant Valentino B Mendoza in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Valentino B Mendoza.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. one additional status granted. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Valentino B Mendoza in court.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Valentino B Mendoza. Defendant is given a copy of the criminal complaint, reading is waived, advised of charges and penalties. Not guilty plea entered by counsel on behalf of defendant. Speedy trial right reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant called CoC, has car issues and is unable to get to court. 1:41 PM case re-called. called. Defendant Valentino B Mendoza in court. James Sempf for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants MFAC once complaint is filed. Repayment to be arranged once complaint is filed. State has not yet made charging decision. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
